alert.note: Alert for Gallatin; Hardin (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 02 at 8:13PM CST until further notice by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following river in Indiana... Kentucky...Illinois... Ohio River at J.T. Myers Dam and Shawneetown. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following river in Indiana... Kentucky... Ohio River at Newburgh Dam and Mount Vernon. .Recent heavy rains in the Ohio River basin are expected to cause rises in the river with multiple locations rising above flood stage this week. For the Ohio River...including Newburgh Dam, Mount Vernon, J.T. Myers Dam, Shawneetown...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE MONDAY NIGHT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Ohio River at Shawneetown. * WHEN...From late Monday night until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 43.0 feet, Several county roads are closed. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM CST Sunday the stage was 29.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Tuesday morning and continue rising to a crest of 41.4 feet Monday, January 10. - Flood stage is 33.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
